intro: Lysichiton album, commonly known as the death camas, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has broad, arrow-shaped leaves and produces toxic berries that are particularly dangerous to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woods or meadows. Due to its toxicity, it is important to exercise caution when handling or consuming any part of this plant.
